title: "Field, Lab, Technical, & Communication Skills"

## Field Skills

- Species identification (fish, amphibians, reptiles, birds)
- Freshwater fish and macroinvertebrate sampling (electrofishing, kick nets, seines, dip nets)
- Salamander and snake capture, handling, measuring, sexing, and marking
- Habitat surveys and ecological monitoring
- Mist netting for bats and birds
- Cover board surveys for herpetofauna
- GPS-based field data collection
- Field safety and environmental compliance

---

## Laboratory Skills

- Algal and diatom identification and analysis
- Diatom species assays
- Soft-algae species assays
- Benthic periphyton sampling and analysis
- Water quality analysis (dissolved oxygen, turbidity, chlorophyll *a*, nutrients)
- Rapidocelis bioassays for water quality
- Confocal microscopy
- PCR and gel electrophoresis
- Sample processing and quality control

---

## Data, Analysis & Technical Skills

- Data analysis and visualization in **R**
- Reproducible research with **Quarto** and **R Markdown**
- Version control using **Git** and **GitHub**
- Introductory GIS mapping and spatial analysis with **ArcGIS Pro**
- Introductory ISO-compliant life cycle assessment (LCA)
- Data organization and documentation
- Figure and infographic development

## Communication & Education Skills

- Scientific writing and peer-reviewed publication
- Science communication for non-technical audiences
- Environmental education and outreach
- Instructional design and laboratory teaching
- Student mentoring and tutoring
- Presentation of technical information to community stakeholders
